Column Comment.0: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.1: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within a schema.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: EXTENTION INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that this table is a user extensionto the PPDM model.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: PRIMARY KEY NAME: The name of the primary key used in the CREATE PRIMARYKEY statement.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: A long description describing the information kept within the table in thePPDM schema.
Column Comment.9: ROW COUNT: The number of rows for this table.
Column Comment.10: ROW COUNT DATE: the date that the row count was calculated.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: TABLE COMMENT: the table comments as provided in the DDL.
Column Comment.13: TABLE TYPE: the type of entry in this table that describes the physicalimplementation, such as table, view, materialized view etc.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
